history.text: I really enjoyed the musical numbers in this movie. How about you?
Yes, I would love to see it as a Broadway Musical!
I bet that would be amazing!
Generally, do you like Disney's 3D animated movies?
I do. They have done a really good job making entertaining and relevant movies lately.
They sure have. Disney will always make movies that will become classics for the future.
I love the comedic elements that get thrown in as well.
Definitely, and great for the whole family to watch together.
I didn't know that Frozen was based on Hans Christian Andersen's "The Snow Queen"
It is interesting how they can take an old fairy tale and turn it into a movie. I wonder if there was a talking snowman in the original?
It is unfortunate that the parents chose to cover up Elsa's magic rather than just help her learn to use it safely.
Yes it is. It is sad that the parents of Elsa and Anna die at sea during a storm.
The King and Queen should have encouraged Anna and Elsa to find common ground and get along as they were isolated in the castle.
I imagine they were driven by their fear of what the people would think of it.
I don't think Elsa meant to hurt Anna with her magic.
I agree. She lost control when she grew anxious.
If only the parents educated Elsa about her magic instead of leaving her to become so insecure about it.
If they had, then I don't think there would be a plot for the movie!
I was totally surprised that Hans ended up being a bad guy.
I don't agree that Elsa is a monster as the Duke portrays her.
Elsa's ice castle was super cool, though.
Yes, the palace she created for herself was stunning.
I didn't realize the snow monster had a name.
I didn't know that either, but I like his name "Marshmallow".
I'm so happy that Elsa could escape from her cell.
And I do like Olaf, he is so cute!
His character made the movie, for sure!
I agree!
Hans is such a villain in this movie! I couldn't believe it either!
Agreed! I wish Anna had been able to punch him when he revealed his true nature.
Right? Her poor heart....
And trying to execute Elsa, I never saw any of this coming in the beginning.
I wonder why none of their people questioned Hans's motivations.
He was too smooth for people to notice.
I believe that is the definition of a sociopath.
Definitely.
The sisters were very fortunate to have Kristoff helping them. Who would have known a complete stranger would become such an important person to them?
Agreed. I felt bad for both Anna and Elsa.
At least they ended up being faithful to one another.
Yes, that is very important.
Once again, if only they had been closer growing up they might have avoided a lot of trouble.
Yes, as it would be in real life as well.
It was very nice chatting with you about Frozen.
You too!
